notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: Knud Petersen, two-story stucco apartment building, 140 Clark Street. Cost, $3,800.
Tobias Sandstrom, two-story brick residence, 7130 Michigan Avenue. Cost, $3,000.
Bethany Old People's Home, three-story brick apartment building, 5020 North Ashland Avenue. Cost, $25,000.
Tom Tomsen, two-story brick dwelling, 2040 Kedzie Avenue. Cost, $5,000.
Mrs. Bolstad, three-story brick dwelling, 1324 North Kedzie Avenue. Cost,$30,000.
William Larsen, two-story brick dwelling, 3133 Cornelia Avenue. Cost, $3,500.
F. W. Williamsen, three-story brick factory, 2527 West Taylor Street. Cost, $13,000.
Emil Nelson, two-story brick dwelling, 1140 Olive Avenue. Cost, $4,000.
R. R. Maas, three-story brick apartment building, 6200-08 Ellis Avenue. Cost, $70,000.
George Gunderson, two-story frame dwelling, 5361 North Central Park. Cost, $2,250.
A. and F. Pedersen, two-story brick dwelling, 728 North Lawndale Avenue. Cost, $4,000.
